intro: Psychotria clavipes, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and warm climates. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are often surrounded by dark green foliage. It thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Psychotria clavipes is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in some indigenous cultures for various health purposes.
